;;M;;任何运动;都可以声称是世界上最好的消遣。但当谈到产生伟大的文学作品时，棒球是独一无二的。美国图书馆把书架上的书架专门用于展示这项需要大脑、节奏缓慢的运动。他们收藏的书籍范围广泛，从最早的球员回忆录，如克里斯蒂·马修森 1912 年的《Pitching in a Pinch》，到著名小说家报道真实比赛的作品（约翰·厄普代克的文章《Hub Fans Bid Kid Adieu》）或重新想象比赛的作品（Don德里罗 1997 年的小说《黑夜传说》）。棒球也一直是社会变革的先兆。它的种族融合预示着民权运动。自由球员数百万美元薪水的上涨预示着 20 世纪 80 年代“贪婪是好事”的经济。这六本关于棒球的书不仅提供了对这项运动的愉快沉浸，而且还阐明了社会的一些更广泛的方面——美国并不是唯一一个为之着迷的社会。

;;

;;“84 年五十九”。; 作者：Edward Achorn。哈珀柯林斯出版社； 400 页； 15.99 美元和 14.99 英镑;

;

;棒球历史爱好者可以滔滔不绝地讲述数百名前明星的成就和统计数据。但他们中只有一小部分人听说过这位在这项运动历史上创造了最伟大赛季的球员：查尔斯·“老霍斯”·拉德伯恩 (Charles “Old Hoss” Radbourn)，他是 1884 年排名第一的普罗维登斯格雷队 (Providence Grays) 的王牌投手。拉德伯恩在球队的比赛中首发并完成了 73 场比赛。 114场比赛。官方记分员将灰军 84 场胜利中的 59 场归功于他（他在 2019 年死后获得了第 60 场胜利）。可以肯定的是，当时的这项运动正处于青春期：拉德伯恩低手投球，他身后的外野手没有手套，全垒打很少见，有时是由于外野手因害怕观众的马下而拒绝取回球等奇怪现象造成的。被踢。但是，爱德华·阿霍恩 (Edward Achorn) 对拉德伯恩神奇的一年进行了生动且深入研究的描述，其最大的乐趣在于它表明，尽管镀金时代的美国似乎遥不可及，但棒球的情节和乐趣在今天基本上保持不变。

;

;;八人出局。; 作者：Eliot Asinof。; Henry Holt & 1py3sef e1v7vv2r0">;;八人出局。公司； 336页； 19.99 美元。石出版社； £18.95;

;

;美国的爵士乐时代始于黑袜队丑闻，其中芝加哥白袜队的球员与1919 年世界职业棒球大赛输给了辛辛那提红人队。艾略特·阿西诺夫 (Eliot Asinof) 在 1963 年描述的假球阴谋和随后的审判后来被拍成一部由约翰·库萨克 (John Cusack) 主演的电影，这并不是一部学术历史。它包括虚构的人物、从未发生过的事件以及虚构的对话和内心独白。这是一部根据真实故事改编的文学作品。它是有史以来最扣人心弦的棒球写作范例之一。

;

;;高薪奴隶。;作者：布拉德·斯奈德。 ;企鹅； 496 页； 17 美元。;

;

;自从棒球成为一项职业运动以来，其经济学一直围绕着寻求出售其服务的球员之间的紧张关系尽可能多的钱和团队老板寻求控制工资。对于20世纪的大多数球员来说，球员都受到抑制工资的“保留条款”的约束，该条款允许球队以上一年的工资无限期地续签合同，并在未经他们同意的情况下进行交易。在《高薪奴隶》中，布拉德·斯奈德讲述了科特·弗拉德（上图所示的击球手）的悲伤传奇，这位黑人外野手牺牲了自己的职业生涯来为球员赢得自由。 1969 年，当圣路易斯红雀队将弗拉德交易到费城费城人队时，弗拉德拒绝加入这座城市球迷种族主义声名狼藉的球队。他写信给这项运动的专员说，他不是“一块可以随意买卖的财产”。 Flood 将案件一路上诉至最高法院，最高法院 1972 年做出的有利于业主的裁决被广泛认为是最糟糕的裁决之一。四年后，棒球运动员工会设法通过仲裁推翻了保留条款，但弗拉德再也没有参加过比赛。

;

;;你必须拥有 Wa。罗伯特·怀廷著。 ;克诺普夫； 416 页； $19;

;

;美国可能将棒球视为“全民消遣”，但在该国，棒球的受欢迎程度远远落后于橄榄球。相比之下，这项运动在东亚大部分地区和拉丁美洲部分地区占据主导地位。没有哪个地方比日本更成功，日本在五届世界棒球经典赛中赢得了三届冠军，并且是现效力于洛杉矶道奇队的大谷翔平的家乡。他是历史上唯一一位同时担任投手和击球手的球员。 （贝比·鲁斯在这两个角色中也表现出色，但不是同时出现。）对于只熟悉美国职业棒球大联盟的读者来说，罗伯特·怀廷通过日本和西方棒球文化差异的生动旅程是一个值得欢迎的纠正。棒球主要是击球手和投手之间一系列一对一的对抗，是最个性化的团队运动之一。但日本在培养明星球员和赢得国际冠军方面取得的成功是建立在通过严格训练实现的“和”理念上的，通常被翻译为“和谐”。搬到那里打球的美国球员更加个人主义。他们认为训练量由他们自己决定。他们对“wa”的理念及其对场内场外克己行为的要求感到困惑。怀廷先生以优雅和活力描述了文化冲突。

;

;;点球成金。迈克尔·刘易斯著。 ;WW诺顿; 336页； 17.95 美元和 12.99 英镑;

;

;即使在布拉德·皮特主演的电影版本于 2011 年上映之前，《点球成金》就有了强有力的支持成为有史以来最有影响力的棒球书籍。小市场奥克兰运动队如何利用统计分析来建立一支由被低估的球员组成的获胜球队的故事已经变得众所周知，以至于它的标题现在已经成为开箱即用的情报的代名词：有“政府的点球成金”、“律师的点球成金”、“农业科技创新的点球成金”，甚至是“荒地消防系统的点球成金”（谷歌搜索）。知识渊博的球迷可能会对田径队的成功到底有多少功劳，以及这支球队到底有多成功提出异议：在过去的 30 年里，它在季后赛中总共赢得了一场系列赛夺得棒球冠军。但由于迈克尔·刘易斯（Michael Lewis）对球队总经理比利·比恩（Billy Beane）的令人信服的心理描绘，这些狡辩很容易被忽视。比利·比恩对统计学家的信心源于他自己作为一名球员的失败，尽管他拥有球探渴望的身体素质。;

;;第四球。; 作者：Jim Bouton。 ;特纳出版公司； 508 页； 39.99 美元和 28.99 英镑;

;

;在每个明星球员的场外缺点都会成为小报素材的时代，很难想象那个时代，有关名人的不雅信息都被保密。但直到吉姆·布顿（上图所示的投手）在写下这本令人捧腹大笑、讲述自己 1969 年赛季的日记时，公众并不知道纽约洋基队受人尊敬的中外野手米基·曼特尔 (Mickey Mantle) 是个酗酒者，他在醉酒状态下击出许多本垒打，或者，球员们经常服用安非他明（“绿党”），设计出各种方案来查找有吸引力的女性观众的裙子（“海狸射击”），并在公路旅行中猖獗地从事婚外情。 （当被问及成为一名棒球运动员最困难的部分时，迈克·赫根打趣道：“向你的妻子解释为什么她需要服用青霉素来治疗你的肾脏感染。”）美国职业棒球大联盟感到愤怒。其专员鲍伊·库恩（Bowie Kuhn）试图让布顿签署一份声明，称其内容纯属虚构，但没有成功，而布顿的揭露使他成为前队友中的贱民。每当皮特·罗斯（Pete Rose）这位后来被;禁止参加这项运动;的明星赌博，与布顿比赛时，他大喊“操你，莎士比亚！”

;;T;< small>;WO WEEKS; before gunmen ;stormed the Crocus City Hall near Moscow;, killing at least 137 people, American intelligence warned that “extremists” had “imminent plans” to attack large events in the city. On March 7th Russian security services said they had foiled an attack by Islamic State (;IS;), a jihadist outfit, on a synagogue in Moscow.因此，在番红花城袭击发生数小时后，该组织声称对此事负责，也就不足为奇了。 3 月 25 日，四名据称来自塔吉克斯坦的嫌疑人出庭。 American officials believe they are part of the Islamic State Khorasan Province (;ISKP;). What is this outfit, and what threat does it pose?

;

;;ISKP; is the Central Asian offshoot of ;IS;, the group that established a “caliphate” in Iraq and Syria in 2014. (;IS; had ;lost most of the land it controlled there; by 2018. Several other offshoots are active in ;Africa; and elsewhere.) Khorasan is a historical area that takes in parts of Iran, Afghanistan and other Central Asian countries (see map). Based mainly in northern and eastern Afghanistan, ;ISKP; is an implacable enemy of the Taliban, an Islamist group that retook control of the country after the departure of American troops in August 2021. ;ISKP; portrays the Taliban as sell-outs for signing a deal with America and co-operating with its withdrawal. It also frequently criticises Tajikistan's dictator, Emomali Rahmon, an ally of Russia's president, Vladimir Putin, in messaging groups because he bans ;outward displays of Islamic belief;.

;;
;;
;

;;ISKP; seems to have been established in 2014. It attracted disaffected members of the Pakistani Taliban as well as Afghan members, whose regime had been routed by American-backed forces by 2003. The group, which follows Sunni Islam, prides itself on being even less forgiving of non-believers and other Islamic groups—including followers of Shia Islam, the second-largest branch of the faith after Sunnism. Between 2019 and 2021 it claimed responsibility for numerous attacks on mosques, funerals and schools in Afghanistan. During America's withdrawal from the country it carried out a ;suicide-bombing at Kabul airport;, killing more than 100 people, including 13 American soldiers.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Since July 2022 Afghanistan's rulers have ordered repeated raids on the group's hideouts. The number of successful attacks by ;ISKP; in the country has fallen. Experts suggest that the raids may have pushed ;ISKP; to look farther afield. In 2022 the group claimed to have fired rockets at military installations in Tajikistan and Uzbekistan. In January 2024 it carried out the worst terrorist attack in Iran's post-revolutionary history, killing more than 100 people at a memorial event for Qassem Soleimani, a military commander assassinated by an American drone in 2020.

;

;;ISKP;'s recruitment strategies have changed. Roughly 4,000 fighters from Central Asia are believed to have joined ;IS; in Iraq and Syria. After the caliphate's overthrow, many returned home. ;ISKP; is trying to enlist them. The group's media operation now uses a range of the region's languages, from Persian to Uzbek. In 2022 it launched Tajik-language networks on Telegram, through which it promotes its intention to topple Mr Rahmon.

;

;The Crocus City attack is the latest evidence that ;ISKP; is turning its attention beyond Central Asia. In January two of its militants attacked a church in Istanbul, killing one person. German officials said they had recently foiled a planned attack. The Moscow atrocity was preceded by a stream of anti-Russian messages on ;ISKP; channels. Mr Putin's relationships with the Taliban and with Mr Rahmon make his country a target. ;ISKP; propaganda also cites his brutal wars in Chechnya, a Muslim-majority region in the Caucasus, his intervention in Syria against IS and the Soviet Union's invasion of Afghanistan during the 1980s as evidence that Russia is hostile to Muslims.

;

;Russia's intelligence agencies may have been too distracted by the war in Ukraine to prevent the attack. Analysts warn that agencies in the West are also strained. The massacre at Crocus City Hall is a bitter reminder that the threat posed by ;IS; remains. ;■;

;Part of Mr Putin's reluctance to go all-in on blaming Ukraine might reflect a worry that the American government is sitting on intelligence that could undermine such a claim. Part might be embarrassment at his security agencies' failure to act on American warnings on March 7th of an imminent attack. Indeed, just three days before the assault Mr Putin had brushed off that intelligence as “blackmail”.在一个可以追究权力责任的国家，这种傲慢的错误将会产生后果。 Russia is not such a country.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The attack nevertheless represents a blow to the reputation of Mr Putin and the security services on which he depends.至少 137 人丧生的袭击方式不会很快被忘记。当枪手用自动步枪开火时，一些受害者在几分钟内被杀。但袭击者放火焚烧礼堂后，大多数人因吸入火灾和烟雾而死亡。当部分屋顶倒塌时，大厅里可能有 200 多人。当急救人员到达闷烧的灰烬时，他们在一个厕所里发现了 28 具尸体。 Whole families had been hiding together, with mothers reportedly shielding their children.

;

;There are many questions over the inept security at the glitzy venue, which is in an entertainment park in Moscow's north-west suburbs.目前尚不清楚当地警方为何未能迅速做出反应。袭击发生前 10 天在 Crocus 市政厅举办的一场节目的制作人指出，当晚有 200 名保安人员在场。 Some apparently unusual aspects of the attack—for supposed jihadists, the killers seemed keen to stay alive—have provoked conspiracy theories that parts of the Russian establishment may have been in on the act.

;

;The more convincing explanation is that an Islamist terrorist group capitalised on Russia's wartime distractions, ethnic tensions and economic difficulties.俄罗斯为圣战分子招募来自中亚穆斯林占多数的前苏联加盟共和国的贫困移民提供了明显的机会。 Unofficial figures suggest that Russia has up to 8m migrants from Tajikistan alone.

;

;These migrants represent an important cog in the wartime economy, taking low-paid jobs that Russians do not want, like road-sweeping and minimum-wage construction.但种族紧张局势一直在加剧。 Mr Putin spoke to them indirectly in his state-of-the-nation speech on February 29th, dialling down his previous nationalist rhetoric and emphasising Russia's “multi-ethnicity”.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The group that has claimed responsibility for the attack is an affiliate of Islamic State that calls itself ;Islamic State-Khorasan Province;.该组织主要以阿富汗为基地，但其追随者遍布中亚，1 月份在伊朗制造了两起爆炸事件，造成 100 多人死亡。 One of the sources of its grievances against Russia is the country's involvement in the war in Syria, where the Kremlin (along with Iran) has backed the Assad regime against Islamic State and other rebels. Islamic State is also suspected of carrying out an attack on the metro in St Petersburg in 2017 that killed 15 people.

;

;After previous crises Mr Putin responded to any questioning of his power by gripping it tighter.当他终于在别斯兰大屠杀后重新出现时，他宣称“弱者必遭殴打”，并取消了地方直接选举。随后对异议和新闻自由的镇压预示着更糟糕的情况即将到来。 More recently Mr Prigozhin's mutiny saw his plane ;blasted out of the sky; after he had supposedly reached a deal with his boss.

;

;The Kremlin will no doubt use the Moscow attack as a pretext to tighten the domestic screws further. Some of its most loyal lieutenants have called for the cancellation of Russia's moratorium on the death penalty for terrorism. That threat takes on extra significance in light of the Kremlin's recent habit of applying that label to opponents of the regime, including an elderly writer of crime fiction.据报道，俄罗斯各大城市的清真寺和旅馆遭到袭击，移民社区已经感受到了压力。 But there is propaganda value in blaming Ukraine, and there are economic risks attached to threatening migrant workers. So the Kremlin is unlikely to deal with its security vulnerabilities systematically.

;

;Indeed, Mr Putin hinted that the main consequences of the terror attack will be felt in Ukraine.他可能会用它来证明动员更多军队参加那里的战争的合理性。与克里姆林宫有联系的媒体正在帮助塑造这种叙事。其中一篇发表的“调查”表明，恐怖分子是乌克兰驻塔吉克斯坦大使馆招募的。 Activists from antibot4navalny, a cyber-monitoring group, have recorded a notable uptick in the social-media activity of bots controlled by the ;FSB;, Russia's security agency. Most of the fake news blamed Ukraine, as well as America and Britain, for the Moscow attack.

;

;An intelligence source in Ukraine says he expects such efforts to be stepped up, using flimsy arguments to redirect blame. “也许他们也会开始指责法国，”他打趣道。 “After all, the men escaped in a Renault.”;■;
